intro: Verbascum × rodnense, commonly known as the hybrid mullein, is a perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the genus Verbascum, which includes several species of flowering plants in the family Scrophulariaceae. The plant is characterized by its tall, hairy stems and large, fuzzy leaves that can reach up to 30 centimeters in length. Its showy yellow flowers appear in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Verbascum × rodnense is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to grow in well-drained soils.
